content: Hello! Thank you for contacting XYZ Home Services. Can I get your name to get started with your service request?
Ugh. Do you really need my name? I just need someone to look at my kitchen sink. It's leaking again and it's a mess.

I understand, and I'm sorry to hear about your sink. I do need a name to make the booking, but it will only take a moment. Could you please provide your name so we can get you scheduled as quickly as possible?
It's Jess, but can you just send someone? Every time I talk to you people I get put on hold or it takes forever. I don't have time for this.
Thank you, Jess. I want to help as quickly as possible. Can you please confirm your address so we can make sure we send a plumber to the right place?
Does it really matter? You should have it on file. Why do I always have to repeat myself?
I apologize, Jess. For security and to make sure we send our technician to the correct location, I need you to confirm your address one more time. Would you mind letting me know your current address?
Fine, it's 45 Oakview Lane, just hurry up. I just know you're going to take hours to reply like last time.
Thank you, Jess. You're within our service area. Could you let me know when would be the best time for one of our plumbers to come out? We have appointments available today and throughout the week.
I doubt anyone will be free today. Every time I try, you say it's booked. I need something between 2 and 4 this afternoon I guess.
We do have a plumber available between 2 and 4 PM today. Would you like me to book this appointment for you?

Honestly, last time your guy was late and didn’t fix the problem. I don’t want to waste my time again. Plus you’re probably going to overcharge me, and I have to call off work for this. Why can’t you just tell me how much it will be?

I understand your concerns, Jess. For kitchen sink leaks, our service call typically starts at $89, and the final price can vary depending on parts and labor needed. We always provide a clear estimate before beginning work. Would you like to go ahead and book the 2–4 PM slot today?
No, I don't think so. I'll try and do it myself first. Maybe I'll call back when you guys can actually promise a fix that lasts longer than two weeks.
reason: Customer declined to schedule due to dissatisfaction with prior service and price concerns.
